meanings.definition: The pointed top of a mountain.
meanings.sent1: The hikers reached the peak of the mountain after a long climb.
meanings.sent2: The snow-covered peak of the mountain glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The peak of the mountain seemed to touch the sky, making it a breathtaking sight.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the peak of the mountain turned a fiery red, like a blazing torch.
meanings.sent5: The view from the peak of the mountain was absolutely stunning, with valleys and lakes stretching out below.

meanings.sent1: During the competition, the athlete reached his peak performance.
meanings.sent2: The company's profits reached their peak last year.
meanings.sent3: At the peak of the party, everyone was dancing and having a great time.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement reached its peak when she saw her favorite band perform live.
meanings.sent5: The temperature in the desert can reach a peak of over 100 degrees in the summer.

meanings.definition: To reach a highest point or level.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, she finally managed to peak in her career.
meanings.sent2: The excitement in the room peaked when the surprise guest arrived.
meanings.sent3: His interest in painting peaked after visiting an art exhibition.
meanings.sent4: The tension between the two characters peaked during the final scene of the movie.
meanings.sent5: The music peaked to a crescendo, filling the concert hall with sound.
